org.opensha2.eq.fault.surface

Class Container2DImpl<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha2.eq.fault.surface.Container2DImpl<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Container2D<T>, Named
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGriddedSurface

    public class Container2DImpl<T>
extends Object
implements Container2D<T>
    Title: Container2D

    Description: Default Container2DAPI implementation class for a 2D grid. This class actually determines the storage mechanism and access to the data. This implementation doesn't allow the internal data structure to resize. Can design a subclass to do this if needed in the future.

    The internal storage is a one dimensional array which is actually accessed by two coordinates x and y, i.e. row and column. The two dimensional indices are translated to a one dimensional index by the mapping:

    index = (the number of columns per row * row) + column.

    Note: This data array stored Objects so the actually data that you store can be any Java class. This container is flexible to hold any type of data at each "grid" point.

    Author:
    Steven W. Rock

      • Container2DImpl

        public Container2DImpl()
        No Argument Constructor for the Container2D object. Set's a default row and column size to = 100.

      • Container2DImpl

        public Container2DImpl(int numRows,
               int numCols)
        Constructs a new Container2D with the supplied dimensions.
        Parameters:
        numRows - number of rows
        numCols - number of columns
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if numRows or numCols are less than 1, or if (numRows * numCols) exceeds the allowable 32-bit address space [2147483647].

      • checkBounds

        protected void checkBounds(int row,
               int column)
                    throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Checks that the specified row and column are valid indices into the 2D array. Internal helper function used only by this class.
        Parameters:
        row - check row value less that max row index
        column - check col value less that max col index
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if row or column < 0 or > max row or max col.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all object reference stored in this container and resets all grid metics back to 0. Doesn't delete the actual objects, only removes the pointer references stored at each grid cell location.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Container2D<T>
